group_1.textRight: Excuse me, thank you for earlier...!
I was in a hurry earlier, so I didn't get a chance@to thank you properly.

group_1.textLeft: Uhhh... Sorry, but I think you've got@the wrong person...?

group_1.textRight: (Her magic pattern is different from earlier...)

group_1.narration: That means the person I met back then isn't the@same as the one I encountered in front of the Coordinator's...
Her magic pattern is that of a Magical Girl's,@so she can't be a Mirrors copy...@Wait...@Could that mean my impostor is a Magical Girl...?
And that magic pattern...
Could it be that her impostor is the same as mine?@In other words,@the impostor could transform into both of us.

group_1.textCenter: Sorry I couldn't be more help.@Good luck findin' your impostor!
Also, I never mentioned I was looking for@an impostor...
Something else feels wrong...
I don't know anything about your impostor!
(If I'm right about this, there's something@I need to check.)
[surround:7105_telphone]...
...Hello, Maria? I have a quick question for you...
Thank you very much. You've been very helpful.
Now, if you'll excuse me...

group_1.narration: *Beep*

group_1.textCenter: (I'm starting to piece things together.)
(Indeed, there were several oddities...)

group_1.narration: [se:7106_telmail]*Ping*â™ª

group_1.textCenter: (...A message from Himika?)

group_1.narration: just got a tip someone saw the impostor at the arcade@how about we meet up at the counseling room@and check it out together?

group_1.textCenter: (I knew I wasn't mistaken when I felt@that something was off...)
(If I'm right about this...)

group_1.narration: The impostor should be at the arcade,@waiting for me to show up...
Because this whole "Impersonator Magical Girl" incident...@was just a setup.
The mastermind is probably Emiri@and the other girls from the counseling room.
And the Coordinator is in on it, too...
I don't know what they're trying to accomplish,@but given all the pranks they've played on me before,@it's reasonable to assume that this is just@another one of them.
I've been panicking because of the impostor,@but now that I've calmed down and given it some thought,@several things have been puzzling me since@the start of this investigation...
First, there are the interviews.
Everyone seemed to be acting, and@their testimonies weren't exactly clear.

group_1.textRight: Come on, Ayaka. You know, Sae's impostor.

group_1.textLeft: Oh, ohhh, the impostor...@Right, the impostor!
I think she was over there...or maybe@she was over here...?
Either way, she was acting pretty wild!

group_1.narration: The photo that Hinano had brought with her@was also impossible, now that I think about it.

group_1.textLeft: A pic of Myako-senpai and Saechi?
It's like one of those scandalous celebrity@photos that pop up in tabloids.
Wha... There's a Sae in the background, too...!

group_1.textRight: I have an enlarged photo of that Sae, too.

group_1.textLeft: She totally gives off bad vibes!

group_1.textRight: That's it! That expression!@That's the one I saw!

group_1.textLeft: And this shot captured the sunset beautifully.

group_1.narration: From the angle of the photo,@I can tell that it was a covert shot of me and Hinano@leaving school together.
But as far as I can remember,@the last time I left school with Hinano@was about two weeks ago.

I can't deny the possibility@that the impostor has been around that long,@but if she's so wild and outspoken that it shocks others,@then it's hard to believe that no rumors@were spread for two weeks...
And most of all,@even if it deals with the paranormal,@it's hard for me to imagine that The Midori Report@would keep such an interesting story under wraps.
Besides,@some of the testimonies just didn't line up with each other,@which tells me their stories were made up.

group_1.textRight: She was selling bentos yesterday evening at@an event in the shopping district.

group_1.textLeft: Right, Manaka-sensei sometimes goes out@and about to sell bentos too!

group_1.textCenter: You were here yesterday evening,@weren't you?

group_1.narration: Manaka was supposed to be selling bentos@in the shopping district yesterday evening,@but apparently served my impostor at the restaurant@around the same time.@The timing doesn't add up.
It might be possible@to use a Magical Girl's power to travel around quickly,@but I don't know why she would go to such lengths.

group_1.textCenter: Now that you mention it, I saw a somewhat@strange-acting Sae in the arcade.
Just a little while ago, on my way home@from school.
Besides, I wouldn't have time to come after@school. There are children for me to look after...

group_1.narration: Maria rarely goes to the arcade,@and on top of that,@she was taking care of children after school.
There's no way she could have seen the impostor there.
And lastly, the girl I met at the arcade...@That girl named Rena.

group_1.textRight: I was just wondering if you've seen a girl@around here who looks like me...

group_1.textLeft: H-huh?! Someone who looks like you?!
I don't know anything about your impostor!

group_1.narration: That girl strangely used the word "impostor"@before I had mentioned it.
That strange choice of words was just like@the girl I met in the alley afterwards.
And, with the information I got from Maria...
The conclusion that can be drawn from all this is...

group_1.textCenter: [flashEffect:flashWhiteSlow2][se:7211_souljem_02]...
(I knew it, that magic pattern...)
You're here, aren't you?
